summary: A letter from defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim to Judge Alison J. Nathan requesting an order to allow Ghislaine Maxwell access to her legal papers while held in a cellblock at the courthouse during evidence review sessions. The letter details Maxwell's schedule on April 13, 2021, and her anticipated attendance at evidence review throughout the week.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell writing to Judge Nathan to request an order allowing Maxwell access to legal papers while in custody.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the request for an order is addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, who is in custody and attending evidence review sessions at the courthouse. The letter seeks to facilitate her access to legal materials.

connections.description: Sternheim is acting as Maxwell's defense attorney, advocating for her access to legal papers while she is in custody.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Maxwell.
Attorney Sternheim is formally corresponding with Judge Nathan regarding a procedural matter in her client's case.

events.title: Maxwell's Courthouse Arrival and Evidence Review
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell arrived at the courthouse at approximately 5:15 am and was held idle in the cellblock until about 8:30 am when she was brought to an evidence review session in the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Defense Request for Access to Legal Papers
events.description: Defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim submitted a letter to Judge Nathan requesting an order to allow Maxwell access to her legal papers while in the cellblock.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
500 Pearl Street (cellblock location), New York, NY
33 West 19th Street - 4th Floor, New York, New York 10011 (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody and attending evidence review sessions in her criminal case as of April 2021.
Her defense attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, requested a court order to ensure Maxwell had access to her legal papers while held in the courthouse cellblock.
On April 13, 2021, Maxwell arrived at the courthouse very early (5:15 am) and had a significant idle period before her 8:30 am evidence review session.
The document is a formal legal correspondence from defense counsel to the presiding judge, highlighting procedural aspects of Maxwell's pre-trial detention and preparation.
